intro: Flueggea prolifera, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers with five petals. The plant thrives in saline environments and is often found in sandy soils near the shore. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Flueggea prolifera is adapted to withstand high salinity and is often used in coastal landscaping for its ornamental value.
